text: Igor Remetić (born 14 September 1976) is a Bosnian professional football manager and former player. ==Playing career== Remetić started his playing career at locl side Velež Mostar, but as the Yugoslav Wars started, he became a refugee in Serbia where he continued his career initnally playing with lower-league side FK Radnički Jaša Tomić. Remetić then continued climbing up his career in the Serbian league system, first playing with Vrbas, and then a longer spell between 1998 and 2003 with third-level AIK Bačka Topola. In the season 2003–04, he moved to Sweden and played with Östers, following a return to the Balkans next season, this time to play with Croatian side GOŠK Dubrovnik between 2004 and 2006. The following season, Remetić returned to Bosnia and Herzegovina and joined Velež Mostar, playing with them in the 2006–07 season. It was then followed by a spell with another Bosnian side, Čapljina between 2008 and 2010. His last season as a player was spent by playing the first part of the 2010–11 season with Rudar Kakanj, before ending his career by playing the rest of the season with Velež Mostar. ==Managerial statistics== {| class="wikitable" tyle="text-align: center" |+ Managerial record by team and tenure !rowspan="2"|Team !rowspan="2"|From !rowspan="2"|To !colspan="8"|Record |- ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! |- |align=left|Turbina Jablanica |align=left|14 August 2015 |align=left|30 June 2016 |- |align=left|TOŠK Tešanj |align=left|1 July 2016 |align=left|11 September 2017 |- |align=left|Travnik |align=left|9 January 2018 |align=left|18 March 2018 |- |align=left|Velež Mostar U17 |align=left|1 July 2019 |align=left|23 October 2019 |- |align=left|TOŠK Tešanj |align=left|3 January 2020 |align=left|6 September 2020 |- !colspan="3"|Total |} ==Honours== ===Player=== GOŠK Dubrovnik *3. title: Igor Remetić
